titleStmt.title: O. Ross Baker et al. to Unknown
CWG7539

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned CPetitioners & ^officers^ in Consideration of the Statements mady by the witnesses, all of whose names appear at the foot of the three indictments against E H Daniel & Bro. and the further fact that the Said Daniels are law obiding and good Citizens of our Caldwell County -- Do respectfully ask your excellency to remit or pardon each of Said indictments -- We think their case merits Your clemency --

O. Ross. Baker Sheriff
Caldwell county
J. C Barnes clerk
Caldwell Circuit Court
J. N. Turner P J C C C
J R Hurst Reprenta^tive^ Of Caldwell Co. --
Fenton Sims Rep of Trigg County --
